means: [希腊神]塞姬（爱神丘比特所爱的美女）

word_mean: ［希］精神，心灵：人类思考、判断、动情感的官能
精神生活，包括意识和无意识过程

sentence.Network_en: His exploration of the myth brings insight into the American psyche.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对这个神话的探讨揭示了美国人的心理。

sentence.Network_en: He portrays the psyche as poly-centric.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他的描绘中精神是多中心的。

sentence.Network_en: She spent her life plumbing the mysteries of the human psyche.
sentence.Network_cn: 她毕生探索人类心灵的奥秘。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: via Latin from Greek psukhē 'breath, life, soul'

encyclopedia.content: 普赛克（Psyche）希腊著名的神话人物，后被转化融入到罗马神话中来，是一位伟大国王膝下三女儿中的小妹妹。她外表和心灵美丽无双，全世界的人们都长途跋涉来敬仰她的美丽。

entry.def: In psychology, your psyche is your mind and your deepest feelings and attitudes.

example.ex: 'It probably shows up a deeply immature part of my psyche,' he confesses...
example.tran: “它可能表现了我内心很不成熟的一面，”他承认道。

example.ex: His exploration of the myth brings insight into the American psyche.
example.tran: 他对这个神话的探讨揭示了美国人的心理。

means.word_mean: 1. that which is responsible for one's thoughts and feelings; the seat of the faculty of reason;

sentences.sentence: "I couldn't get his words out of my head"

means.word_mean: 2. the immaterial part of a person; the actuating cause of an individual life

auth_sentence.content: We must learn behavior of people by their psyche.

means.word_mean: 使进入正常的心理状态

sentences.en: The coach psyched the team before the game.
sentences.cn: 教练在赛前使队员在心理上充分作好准备。

means.word_mean: 使激动：使…在情感上兴奋

sentences.en: She had psyched herself up so much for the camping trip that she forgot her sleeping bag.
sentences.cn: 因为要出去野营，她特别地激动，以至于忘了带睡袋。
